entry.title: Russia Withdraws More Forces From Northeast Ukraine
entry.content: Russia retreated from a vast swath of northeastern Ukraine as Kyiv’s forces continued their push into Russian-occupied territory and the government pledged that all areas seized by Moscow would be retaken.

entry.title: King Charles Leads Royal Procession in Edinburgh After Addressing British Lawmakers
entry.content: The new king and Queen Elizabeth’s three other children paid tribute to the late monarch in a solemn march along the Royal Mile.

entry.title: King Charles III Ushers In a More Informal, Transparent Monarchy
entry.content: Buckingham Palace is using the 10 days of national mourning to place the new king firmly in the public eye, further searing the House of Windsor into the nation’s psyche.

entry.title: Soaring Food Prices in Brazil Lead Many to Take Up Urban Farming
entry.content: Community gardens and urban agriculture are taking root in the favelas of Rio de Janeiro and other Brazilian cities, as hunger affects millions more people.

entry.title: Famine Threatens East Africa as Drought Persists
entry.content: East Africans grappling with the devastating effects of four straight failed rainy seasons are confronting the likelihood that the next rains will also come up short, deepening a hunger emergency that could tip into famine in some areas within weeks.
